in machine learning.
Example 7.7 (Convex Conjugates)
To illustrate the application of convex conjugates, consider the quadratic
function
f(y) = λ
2 y⊤K−1y (7.59)
based on a positive deﬁnite matrix K ∈ Rn×n. We denote the primal
variable to be y∈Rn and the dual variable to be α∈Rn.
Applying Deﬁnition 7.4, we obtain the function
f∗(α) = sup
y∈Rn
⟨y,α⟩− λ
2 y⊤K−1y. (7.60)
